snippet: Bridgette Harvan, 21, has worked at her grandmother’s diner since she was 9. But as the breakfast regulars reminisce of better days in Elyria, Ohio, she dreams of a brighter future in a rejuvenated town.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column on Bridgette Harvan of Elyria, Ohio, who is forging a new path away from her grandmother's restaurant, Donna's Diner, where she has worked since childhood, by attending Lorain County Community College; college is committed to helping Elyria--and northeastern Ohio--regain its economic viability, now that its once-dominant manufacturing base has been displaced by the service industry (Series: Donna's Diner).
lead_paragraph: Bridgette Harvan, 21, has worked at her grandmother’s diner since she was 9. But as the breakfast regulars reminisce of better days in Elyria, Ohio, she dreams of a brighter future in a rejuvenated town.

headline.print_headline: After Childhood Pouring Refills, Reaching Beyond the Past
headline.seo: This Land: After a Childhood Pouring Refills, Reaching Beyond the Past
headline.main: After a Childhood Pouring Refills, Reaching Beyond the Past
